definition: see 窩裡鬥|窝里斗[wo1 li5 dou4]
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
Li (surname)
lining/interior/inside/internal/also written 裏|里[li3]
variant of 裡|里[li3]
contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
internal strife (family, group, etc)
variant of 內訌|内讧[nei4 hong4]
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
dog-eat-dog/dogfight
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
to sow dissension (idiom); to drive a wedge between
to lend sb a knife to kill sb/to get sb else to do one's dirty work/to attack using the strength of another (idiom)
scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
internecine strife (idiom); fighting among oneself
benefit from others' dispute (idiom)
to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
to work against the interests of sb one derives support from/to double-cross one's employer/to bite the hand that feeds you
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
to take advantage of sb's misfortune/to loot
